title: Reduced billing prompt
hypothesis:
We believe that many users are not completing the most valuable actions they can first because there are too many call to actions and prompts throughout the product that are not intended for new signups.Â 

If we reduce prompts driving users to billing configuration, new users will be more likely to take actions that will add the most value for them and go on to have success.

This experiment targets users who have billing alerts and within a 1 day grace period of completing their account set up.
results: We observed a (statistically significant) decrease in flow sends.
summary: Does reducing actions on home increase adoption of activation behaviors? It did not.
